page.title: 09 EDUCATION IN KENNINGTON
page.content: In the area there are 9 places of education. They are: Towers (ages 11-18), 2 Primary (7-11), 2 Infants (4-7), 3 Playschools (2-4) and 1 Police College. Towers has around 1000 pupils, 58 staff and 57 classrooms. There are many sports pitches at Towers as well as 2 sports halls a swimming pool and 9 tennis courts, all in the schools 13 acres of land. there are 25 lessons a week, each 1 hour long. In both of the Primary schools, there are about 10 classrooms, 2 playgrounds, 1 hall, 1 medical room and 10 staff. The 3 playschools are in use only during the mornings of 4 days a week. At the playschools, there is just 1 main room and about 40 youngsters are looked after by about 4 adults. The Police College is used entirely for the training of young police cadets.
